prompt: Facts: The case involves an appeal against the High Court of Punjab and Haryana's order dated 09.05.2023, which dismissed the appellant's application for anticipatory bail.; An FIR No. 14 was registered on 16.01.2023 at Police Station Sadar, District Fazilka.; The FIR was registered under Sections 452, 323, 354, 379B, 506, 148, 149 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).; The allegations state that on 16.01.2023 at about 11:00 AM, the appellant (Kulwinder Singh) along with other co-accused formed an unlawful assembly.; Members of the assembly were allegedly armed with sticks ('soti').; They allegedly trespassed into the house of the complainant (Respondent No. 2).; They allegedly assaulted the complainant and his wife, Gurmeet Kaur.; Specifically, it was alleged that the appellant outraged the modesty of Gurmeet Kaur (Section 354 IPC).; It was further alleged that the appellant snatched the gold earrings ('walis') worn by Gurmeet Kaur by using force (implicating Section 379B IPC).; The accused allegedly threatened to kill the complainant and his wife (Section 506 IPC).; The appellant's application for anticipatory bail was rejected by the Sessions Court.; The High Court also rejected the anticipatory bail application, noting the seriousness of the allegations, particularly Sections 354 and 379B IPC, and the need for custodial interrogation for recovery of the snatched earrings and the weapons used.; The Supreme Court heard the appeal challenging the High Court's rejection of anticipatory bail. | IPC: Section 148 (Rioting, armed with deadly weapon), Section 149 (Unlawful assembly common object), Section 323 (Voluntarily causing hurt), Section 354 (Outraging modesty of woman), Section 379B (Snatching with force/preparation), Section 452 (House-trespass with preparation for assault), Section 506 (Criminal intimidation)
completion: {"prosecution": [{"argument": "Denial of anticipatory bail is justified due to seriousness of offenses including house trespass, outraging modesty, and snatching with force.", "precedents": ["State rep. by CBI vs. Anil Sharma (1997) 7 SCC 187", "Jai Prakash Singh v. State of Bihar (2012) 4 SCC 379", "P. Chidambaram v. Directorate of Enforcement (2019) 9 SCC 24"]}, {"argument": "Custodial interrogation needed for recovery of earrings and weapons", "precedents": ["State rep. by CBI vs. Anil Sharma (1997) 7 SCC 187", "Sumitha Pradeep v. Arun Kumar C.K. (2022) SCC OnLine SC 1529", "Nimmagadda Prasad v. CBI (2013) 7 SCC 466"]}], "defense": [{"argument": "Allegations are false/exaggerated due to pre-existing dispute", "precedents": ["Siddharam Satlingappa Mhetre v. State of Maharashtra (2011) 1 SCC 694", "Bhagwan Singh v. Dilip Kumar @ Deepu @ Depak 2023 SCC OnLine SC 1059", "Data Ram Singh v. State of U.P. (2018) 3 SCC 22"]}, {"argument": "Custodial interrogation not required with cooperation", "precedents": ["Gurbaksh Singh Sibbia vs State of Punjab (1980) 2 SCC 565", "Sushila Aggarwal v. State (NCT of Delhi) (2020) 5 SCC 1", "Satender Kumar Antil v. CBI (2022) 10 SCC 51"]}, {"argument": "High Court erred in mechanical denial of bail", "precedents": ["Gurbaksh Singh Sibbia vs State of Punjab (1980) 2 SCC 565", "Ravindra Saxena v. State of Rajasthan (2010) 1 SCC 684", "Prasanta Kumar Sarkar v. Ashis Chatterjee (2010) 14 SCC 496"]}]}
